answers.answer: I think you need to see a physician immediately.
DD would include organic brain lesion, such as a tumor, other metabolic diseases and various forms of psychosis.you need a doc ASAP, brain scan, blood work.

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Please consult a doctor immediately both for a clinical and a psychological assessment. Depression, dementia, alcohol abuse, migraines, diabetes, abuse of certain drugs etc can also cause auditory hallucinations or hearing voices. It can also be a part of schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, schizophreniform disorder, shared psychotic disorder, brief psychotic disorder, bipolar disorder, substance-induced psychotic disorder.Hence it is important to consult a doctor as soon as possible. Take care!

question: Recently.. I've had very very strange neuro symptoms happening.. I'm hearing a voice from a reoccurring dream, I'm dreaming when I'm awake ,the voice is in a rhythm.. and when this happens I go into a rhythm myself, can't control it.. I have to move to the beat.. or speak to the beat or tap or count.. does any body know what this could be? I'm also smelling burning rubber a lot! ??????
title: Dreaming when awake.. voices from a dream playing in a rhythm..
